p: The total land area in Alaska is approximately 151,773.3 km 2, with over 54,563 km of tidal shoreline, including islands, and stretches in latitude by nearly 20°. Seventeen of the 20 highest mountain peaks of North America are in Alaska, with the highest elevation at Mt. McKinley (6,150 m.a.s.l), and lowest at the Pacific Ocean coastline (0 m.a.s.l). Presently, there are approximately 100,000 glaciers covering 75,109.9 km 2 (5% of the total land area of Alaska); however, during the LGM, glaciers covered an estimated 30% of the state. Present mean temperature is 16.8°C during the summer, and −11.0°C during the winter.
